name: Powdery Mildew (Cucumbers)
symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves, stems, and flowers
precautions: Ensure good air circulation around plants
cure: Apply sulfur-based or potassium bicarbonate fungicides.

name: Apple Scab
symptoms: Olive-green or black spots on leaves and fruit
precautions: Prune trees to improve air circulation
cure: Use fungicides like captan or myclobutanil.

name: Bacterial Leaf Spot (Peppers)
symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown
Small, sunken, black spots on fruits
precautions: Avoid working in the garden when plants are wet
cure: Apply copper-based fungicides to reduce the spread.

name: Blossom End Rot (Tomatoes)
symptoms: Dark, sunken spots at the blossom end of the fruit
precautions: Ensure proper calcium levels in soil
cure: Apply calcium-rich foliar sprays and water plants evenly.

name: Downy Mildew (Grapes)
symptoms: Yellow patches on the upper side of leaves
White fluffy growth on the undersides of leaves
cure: Apply fungicides containing mancozeb or copper.

name: Anthracnose (Beans)
symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on stems, leaves, and pods
Black streaks on stems and petioles
cure: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper-based products.

name: Verticillium Wilt (Potatoes)
symptoms: Brown streaks in the vascular tissue of stems
cure: No cure; manage by using resistant varieties and rotating crops.

name: Clubroot (Cabbage)
precautions: Raise soil pH by applying lime
cure: No cure; manage by rotating crops and adjusting soil pH.
